remarks: The operator norm is a bound on the size of an operator, even when it is infinite (using extended real multiplication).  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 18-Oct-2015.)
statement:
nmofval.1 $e |- N = ( S normOp T ) $.
nmoi.2 $e |- V = ( Base ` S ) $.
nmoi.3 $e |- L = ( norm ` S ) $.
nmoi.4 $e |- M = ( norm ` T ) $.
nmoix $p |- ( ( ( S e. NrmGrp /\ T e. NrmGrp /\ F e. ( S GrpHom T ) ) /\ X e. V ) -> ( M ` ( F ` X ) ) <_ ( ( N ` F ) *e ( L ` X ) ) ) $.
